title: Triple panic when no space left on device

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust // I don't think the code is relevant. ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 Afraid I can't test this on another version as I have already recovered the disk space. FYI this happened on AWS. ``` ``` thread 'opt 44x51xau9vv6hyly' panicked at 'Error writing pre-lto-bitcode file `/home/ec2-user/ttgv/target/release/incremental/ttgv-3s7phrfcq65zj/s-g5x0a8jcj3-b6wxlq-working/44x51xau9vv6hyly.pre-lto.bc`: No space left on device (os error 28)', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/write.rs:831:21 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack thread '' panicked at '/rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/write.rs:1509:21: worker thread panicked', compiler/rustc_middle/src/util/bug.rs:35:26 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: failed to write query cache to `/home/ec2-user/ttgv/target/release/incremental/ttgv-3s7phrfcq65zj/s-g5x0a8jcj3-b6wxlq-working/query-cache.bin`: No space left on device (os error 28) error: failed to write dependency graph to `/home/ec2-user/ttgv/target/release/incremental/ttgv-3s7phrfcq65zj/s-g5x0a8jcj3-b6wxlq-working/dep-graph.part.bin`: No space left on device (os error 28) thread 'rustc' panicked at '/rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/write.rs:1824:17: panic during codegen/LLVM phase', compiler/rustc_middle/src/util/bug.rs:35:26 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` not available for this problem ```
